description.en: The course will combine lectures with seminars and  written homework (desk research, self-reflections, discussion papers). The course will end with a reflection paper: a student will demonstrate his or her understandings of family and childhood frameworks from the angles that had been discussed during the course.

objectives.en: The course is aimed to develop awareness in the topics related to contemporary families and childhoods. A specific focus in this course will be put on children and their subjective well-being in local and international perspectives.

notes.et: I will start the course face-to-face in the lecture room. Please follow the schedule and the numbers of the lecture rooms

independent_work.et: see in Moodle: what is Memory Talk/Discussion Paper/Final Reflection Paper/Active participation in seminars - seminar presentation

grade_preconditions.et: Submission of home assignments and seminar presentation

grade_evaluation.et:
Memory Talk - 20 points (incl. 5 without grading and max 15 graded ) 
Discussion papers 2x20 - maximum 40 points
Seminar presentation - 10 points (without grading)
Final Reflection Paper - maximum 30 points

Final grading (total points): 0-50(F); 51-60(E); 61-70(D); 71-80(C); 81-90(B); 91-100(A)

debt_elimination.et: A week after the deadline if there are meaningful reasons but not later than the submission of the Final Reflection Paper (on special occasions please consult the lecturer)

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials: See on the lecture slides and the files attached to Moodle. Students are invited to find more sources, depending on their own focus taken in their papers during the course
